summary: The mod aims to improve it by transforming Whiterun into a major commercial hub of Skyrim while remaining close to vanilla. It adds lots of small details to Whiterun.
descriptionHtml:
[SIZE=7][COLOR=#FFFFFF][B]More Whiterun. The Second Edition[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]



[COLOR=#FFC000][SIZE=5][B]Description[/B][/SIZE][/COLOR]

The mod is a sequel to the original [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13475/] More Whiterun [/URL] Released with the permission of [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/400079/] @ukgazzer [/URL]

Whiterun has lots of empty spaces and does not feel like a major commercial hub as it supposed to be. 

The mod aims to improve it by transforming Whiterun into a trade city of Skyrim while remaining close to vanilla. It adds lots of small details to Whiterun including:

[LIST]
[*] 12 more houses
[*] One hiding place 
[*] 6 new merchants 
[*] 17 unique residents with their own daily tasks
[*] Trainers and two new potential followers
[*] A short adventure
[*] Changes in the city design
[/LIST]

Mod’s NPCs can be a part of Whiterun radiant quests. 

The mod was cleaned in TES5Edit and supports Skyrim 1.9.29.0.8 patch. 


[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Change Log[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

Version 1.1
[LIST]
[*] Fixed large house behind Talos statue
[*] Fixed minor bugs for the Whiterun landscape design
[/LIST]


Version 1.0.3
[LIST]
[*] Cleaned in Tes5Edit 3.0.30
[/LIST]

Version 1.0.2
[LIST]
[*] Corrects facegen data
[/LIST]


Version 1.0.1
[LIST]
[*] Includes missing facegen textures
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Requirements[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

There are two identical versions of the mod. The difference is in their compatibility with Hearthfire DLC as Hearthfire alters navmesh in Whiterun: 

[LIST]
[*] Hearthfire edition. Requires Hearthfire DLC
[*] Vanilla edition. Requires Skyrim.esm and Update.esm
[/LIST]


[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Installation[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

1. Save somewhere outside Whiterun;
2.  Use NMM to install the mod;
3. Wait for 24 hours before visiting Whiterun to let the mod initiate itself properly. 


[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Load Order[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

[LIST]
[*] The mod edits WhiterunWorld only, so MoreWhiterunSE.esp can be placed somewhere at the top of your load order. 
[*] If you are running Realistic Lighting Overhaul, the patch MoreWhiterunSE_RLO_MCE_Patch.esp [b]MUST[/b] be placed [b]AFTER[/b] Realistic Lighting Overhaul - Major City Exteriors.esp
[/LIST]


[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Compatibility[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

Fully compatible with the Civil War questline. Mod’s NPCs will stay in their homes during the Whiterun Siege.

[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9201/] Populated Cities [/URL]
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30450/] Realistic Lighting Overhaul [/URL]. The patch is included
[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11534/] Whiterun Outskirts Market [/URL]. Requires [URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27276/] this patch [/URL]
Any mods that don\'t edit Whiterun


[SIZE=5][COLOR=#FFC000][B]Credits[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

[URL=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/400079/] @ukgazzer [/URL] for the original mod.  If you like this mod, consider to give a kudo to @ukgazzer.
author: Varakz
